definition: (Mahatma) Gandhi
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
sweet/willing
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: It was the cruellest blow to Gandhi.
sentences.chinese: 这是对甘地最残酷的打击。

sentences.english: I can explain it best by something which Mahatma Gandhi said to me.
sentences.chinese: 圣雄甘地曾经过我说过的话可以帮助大家理解它。

sentences.english: JVG is a really good coach, that's the truth.
sentences.chinese: 范甘地真的是一个很好的教练，那是事实。

sentences.english: We never studied Gandhi in school, for instance.
sentences.chinese: 比如，我们在学校从不学习甘地。

sentences.english: As a frontispiece to the book there is a photograph of Gandhi's possessions at the time of his death.
sentences.chinese: 书的卷首插图有甘地去世时的财物的照片。

sentences.english: Soon Gandhi was expounding the doctrine of ahimsa (nonviolence).
sentences.chinese: 不久甘地就四出阐释非暴力主义思想。

sentences.english: Gandhi is at the Hsin Sheng.
Gandhi says reviving the party remains his main goal.
sentences.chinese: 甘地说，恢复他的党仍然是主要目标。

sentences.english: Gandhi tried hard to struggle against racial discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 甘地为反对种族岐视而进行了艰苦的斗争。

sentences.english: Yesterday, 30th January was the anniversary of the death of Gandhi.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，一月三十号，是甘地的祭日。

sentences.english: How much formal authority did Mohandas Gandhi and Martin Luther King Jr. have?
sentences.chinese: 甘地和马丁。路得金有多少权力？

sentences.english: Ghandi says 'be the change you want to see'.
sentences.chinese: 甘地说，“成为你想要看到的改变”。

sentences.english: Gandhi won his first non-violent struggle against racial discrimination.
sentences.chinese: 甘地在种族岐视上赢得了他第一次非暴力战争。

sentences.english: Gandhiji's non-violence, I understand, is not only not using guns and bombs.
sentences.chinese: 甘地的非武力，我明白不只是不使用枪和炸弹。

sentences.english: Hostile interpretations of Gandhi's acts stalked him throughout his life.
sentences.chinese: 针对甘地行为的敌对诠释困扰了他一辈子。

sentences.english: Eventually, his practices of non-violence forced the government of South Africa to change the laws.
sentences.chinese: 最后，甘地的非暴力运动终于迫使南非政府修改法律。

definition: Jawaharlal Nehru (1889-1964), Indian politician, first prime minister 1947-1964
Nelson Mandela (1918-2013), South African ANC politician, president of South Africa 1994-1999
Indian Congress party
Martin Luther King, Jr. (1929-1968), American clergyman and civil rights activist
Anwar Al Sadat
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Winston Churchill (1874-1965), UK politican and prime minister 1940-1945 and 1951-1955/surname Churchill
Leon Davidovich Trotsky (1879-1940), early Bolshevik leader, exiled by Stalin in 1929 and murdered in 1940
Adolf Hitler (1889-1945)
liberation movement
Sikhism
apartheid
Benito Mussolini (1883-1945), Italian fascist dictator, "Il Duce", president 1922-1943
Mohammed Abdel Rahman Abdel Raouf Arafat al-Qudwa al-Husseini (1929-2004), Palestinian leader, popularly known as Yasser Arafat 亞西爾·阿拉法特|亚西尔·阿拉法特[Ya4 xi1 er3 · A1 la1 fa3 te4]
Aung San Suu Kyi (1945-), Myanmar opposition leader and 1991 Nobel Peace laureate/also written 昂山素姬
Pol Pot (1925-1998), Cambodian communist leader
